lexa.core.expression.function

Class FunctionDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.expression.function.FunctionDefinition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FunctionFromExpression, InternalFunction

    public abstract class FunctionDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for a function to be used by the expressions engine.

    Link lexa.core.expression.function.standard

    Since:
    2013-09
    Author:
    William

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionDefinition

        public FunctionDefinition(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String arguments)
        Create a new function.

        This initiates the base settings for a function.

        The arguments are a list of names; with the last optionally set to * for a variable number of arguments.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the function.
        arguments - space separated list of arguments for the function.

      • FunctionDefinition

        public FunctionDefinition(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String... arguments)
        Create a new function.

        This initiates the base settings for a function.

        The arguments are a list of names; with the last optionally set to * for a variable number of arguments.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the function.
        arguments - a list of arguments for the function.

    • Method Detail

      • checkArguments

        private void checkArguments(lexa.core.data.DataSet arguments)
                     throws ExpressionException
        Check that all the arguments are defined.
        Parameters:
        arguments - argument data for the function
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when an argument is missing.

      • getArgumentCount

        public int getArgumentCount()
        Gets the number of arguments defined for the function.
        Returns:
        the number of arguments required.

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.Object evaluate(lexa.core.data.DataSet data,
                                 Expression[] argumentExpressions)
                          throws ExpressionException
        Evaluate the function.

        The arguments are checked and then the function is executed.

        Parameters:
        data - source data for function
        argumentExpressions - the arguments as listed by the function definition
        Returns:
        the result of evaluating the function.
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when the function fails.

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.Object evaluate(lexa.core.data.DataSet arguments)
                          throws ExpressionException
        Evaluate the function.

        The arguments are checked and then the function is executed.

        Parameters:
        arguments - argument data for the function
        Returns:
        the result of the function
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - when the evaluation fails
        See Also:
        execute(lexa.core.data.DataSet)

        Returns:
        the result of the function
        Throws:

        Parse the function for valid syntax for the current library.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
